description: This course explores contemporary biological issues related to health and the environment, with
the goal of fostering informed citizens prepared for current biological debates.  Students learn
the relevant biological principles in lecture and lab followed by appropriate lab or field
research. Specific topics vary from year to year and may include emerging diseases, cardiovascular
health, genetics, specific groups of organisms, behavior, and environmental dynamics. Students
attend lectures plus one two-hour laboratory per week. Offered periodically.
